Lobbyist Name: Walkinstown Association for People with an Intellectual Disability Ltd
Specific Details: Funding to support people with disabilities to access mainstream training, education and employment
DPOs Lobbied: Gerald Nash|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas::Mary Moran|Senator|Seanad::Mark Dearey|Councillor|Louth County council::Colm Markey|Councillor|Louth County council::Maeve Anna Yore|Councillor|Louth County council::Liam Reilly|Councillor|Louth County council::Pearse McGeough|Councillor|Louth County council::Imelda Munster|Councillor|Louth County council::Teresa Leonard|Assistant Secretary|Department of Social Protection
Subject Matter: Funding to support people with disabilities to access mainstream training, education and employment
Intended Results: Greater inclusion for young people aged 16-24, with a disability through access to mainstream training education and employment opportunities.
Lobbying Activities:
Update regarding activities of WALK PEER in the Louth area, young people being engaged with, gap in supports.
Specific reference to funding opportunities being sought including Dormant Accounts; Corporate Funding, etc.|Meeting|2-5::Enquiries relating to publication of Comprehensive Employment Strategy for People with Disabilities
Updates regarding activities of WALK PEER in the Louth area, young people being engaged with, gap in supports.
Notification of application. Feedback on unsuccessful applications
Updates and feedback on Comprehensive Employment Strategy for People with Disabilities publication|Email|6-10::Attendance at Louth County Economic and Community Forum; Leader Local Development Strategy groups; PPN meetings, etc.
Informal conversations with DPOs regarding inclusion of young people with disabilities in County Plans (for example Local Economic and Community Plan); Funding streams; etc in terms of access to mainstream opportunities. 
Conversations with DPOs regarding gaps for young people with disabilities in the Louth area in accessing mainstream training, education and employment. 
Meeting MEPs at events - informal discussion relating to gaps in support for young people with disabilities. Young people with disabilities not being included in Youth Guarantee|Informal communication|6-10::Presentation on WALK PEER Programme as a model of supported employment to be mainstreamed through the Comprehensive Employment Strategy|Meeting|1

Specific Details: Senator Nash raised a metter of concern to our members during a session of the Seanad.  We then reached out to him to express our gratitude for raising the matter and to discuss ensuring compliance with the Employment Regulation Order by not only companies providing security services but my government departments and agencies.   Senator Nash expressed that he had requested compliance feedback from all government departments.
Subject Matter: Senator Nash raised a metter of concern to our members during a session of the Seanad.  We then reached out to him to express our gratitude for raising the matter and to discuss ensuring compliance with the Employment Regulation Order by not only companies providing security services but my government departments and agencies.   Senator Nash expressed that he had requested compliance feedback from all government departments.
Intended Results: Full compliance with the Security Industry Employment Regulation Order
Lobbying Activities: We met with Senator Ged Nash to discuss our shared concern about non-compliance with the Security Industry Employment Regulation Order.|Meeting|1

Specific Details: We spoke to Senator Nash about the scientific research we are conducting on Crohn's disease as he is a spokesperson on the matter and the Ireland Strategic Investment Fund are a GMI investor therefore it is relevant for him to be aware of the connection.
Subject Matter: We spoke to Senator Nash about the scientific research we are conducting on Crohn's disease as he is a spokesperson on the matter and the Ireland Strategic Investment Fund are a GMI investor therefore it is relevant for him to be aware of the connection.
Intended Results: Build awareness
